Title: How to prove: $\left(\frac{2}{\sqrt{4-3\sqrt[4]{5}+2\sqrt[4]{25}-\sqrt[4]{125}}}-1\right)^{4}=5$?
Content:
Question: show that: the beautiful ${\tt sqrt}$-identity: $$
\left({2 \over \sqrt{\vphantom{\Large A}\, 4\ -\ 3\,\sqrt[4]{\,5\,}\
+\ 2\,\sqrt[4]{\,25\,}\ - \,\sqrt[4]{\,125\,}\,}\,}\ -\ 1\right)^{4}
=5
$$ Can you someone have methods to prove this by hand? (Maybe this problem have many methods?because this result is integer. It's a surprise to me.)
Thank you Because I found this
$$4\ -\ 3\sqrt[4]{\,5\,}\ +\ 2\sqrt[4]{\,25\,}\ -\ \sqrt[4]{\,125\,}$$ is not square numbers.
AcceptedAnswer:
Hint: Set $x=5^{1/4}$, then
$$
\frac{2}{\sqrt{4-3x+2x^2-x^3}}-1=x
$$
This equation simplifies to 
$$
x(x^4-5)=0
$$
The rest is clear.
